DOC.brief_summary: This research study determine use combination 4-mg nicotine lozenge , self-help material , and/or telephone tobacco cessation counsel help smokeless tobacco user stop use tobacco . The study consist three intervention : 1 . The Lozenge Assisted Self-help intervention - lozenge nicotine replacement therapy , phone counseling , self help material 2 . Assisted Self-Help intervention - self-help material phone counsel without lozenge 3 . Lozenge Self Help intervention - self help material lozenge nicotine replacement therapy . Hypothesis : The Lozenge Assisted Self-help intervention significantly increase prolonged point prevalence tobacco smokeless tobacco ( ST ) abstinence rate 6 month among ST user interested achieve tobacco abstinence , compare Assisted Self-Help intervention Lozenge Self Help intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Nicotine Lozenges Assisted Self-help Smokeless Tobacco Cessation
DOC.detailed_description: The overarch aim line research develop effective ST intervention disseminate . In order accomplish aim , investigator enroll 1011 ST user multicenter , randomize control trial . The primary aim hypothesis test study follow : 1 . To evaluate effectiveness ST intervention combine nicotine lozenge assist self-help ( LASH ) increase prolonged point prevalence tobacco ST abstinence rate 6 month follow-up compare assisted self-help intervention ( ASH ) among ST user interested achieve tobacco abstinence . Hypothesis : The LASH intervention - add lozenge nicotine replacement therapy ( NRT ) - significantly increase prolonged point prevalence tobacco ST abstinence rate compare ASH intervention 6 month among ST user interested achieve tobacco abstinence . 2 . To evaluate effectiveness ST intervention combine nicotine lozenge assist self-help ( LASH ) increase prolonged point prevalence tobacco ST abstinence rate 6 month follow-up compare lozenge plus self-help intervention ( LSH group : telephone counsel ) among ST user interested achieve tobacco abstinence . Hypothesis : The LASH intervention significantly increase point prevalence abstinence rate tobacco ST 6 month compare LSH intervention among ST user interested achieve tobacco abstinence . Secondary aim test study : 1 . To evaluate incremental cost-per-quit add nicotine lozenge assist self-help intervention ( add assist self-help intervention nicotine lozenge intervention ) increase tobacco abstinence rate . 2 . To evaluate change self-efficacy theoretically-relevant measure relate use nicotine lozenge potential mediator tobacco abstinence . The investigator also examine exploratory aim : 1 . To evaluate relationship nicotine metabolite ratio ( i.e. , ratio trans-3'-hydroxycotinine cotinine ) number lozenge use ST abstinence among ST user receive nicotine lozenge LASH intervention .
